Package model

Class Snake

java.lang.Object
model.Snake
public class Snake extends Object
Represents the Snake player in a game of Snake
Author:
Vannela Chatla

    Class

    static enum 
    Snake.Direction
    An enum that represents one of the four directions: Up, Down, Left, or Right

  • Constructor Details

    • Snake

      public Snake()
      Create a new Snake object with default location and direction

    • Snake

      public Snake(int x, int y, javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
      Create a new Snake object with a specified location and color with the default direction
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the desired location
      y - The y-coordinate of the desired location
      color - The desired color of the Snake

  • Method Details

    • getHead

      public Tile getHead()
      Get the location of the head of the Snake
      Returns:
      a Point object with the x- and y-coordinate of the head of the Snake

    • draw

      public void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Draw the snake to the screen one segment at a time
      Parameters:
      gc - A GraphicsContext object used to draw to the screen

    • getBody

      public List<Tile> getBody()
      Get the entire Snake's body
      Returns:
      A List of Point objects that give the coordinates of each segment

    • move

      public void move()
      Move the Snake by one tile in the current direction

    • grow

      public void grow()
      Grow the Snake by one segment if the Snake has consumed a Pellet

    • setPoweredUp

      public void setPoweredUp(boolean newSate)
      Set whether the snake is powered up, start a timer if it is
      Parameters:
      newSate - A boolean representing whether the snake is now powered up or not

    • isPoweredUp

      public boolean isPoweredUp()
      Get whether the snake has a power up
      Returns:
      True if the snake is powered up, False otherwise

    • setDirection

      public void setDirection(Snake.Direction direction)
      Set the current direction of the Snake based off user input
      Parameters:
      direction - The new direction the Snake should move

    • size

      public int size()
      Get the current size of the Snake
      Returns:
      An integer representing the size of the Snake

    • getDirection

      public Snake.Direction getDirection()
      Get the current direction the Snake is moving
      Returns:
      A Direction enum representing the current direction

    • hasCollidedWithSelf

      public boolean hasCollidedWithSelf()
      Determines if the Snake has collided with its own body
      Returns:
      True if there is a collision between the head and the body, False otherwise
